measuring luminous flux per unit area. It is equal to one lumen per square metre.

In photometry, luminous intensity is a measure of the wavelength-weighted 
power emitted by a light source in a particular direction per unit solid angle, 
based on the luminosity function, a standardized model of the sensitivity of the 
human eye. The SI unit of luminous intensity is the candela (cd), an SI base unit. 
... A typical candle produces very roughly one candela of luminous intensity.
